description:
Everyone has regrets in life. So who wouldn't take the chance to change the past if given the opportunity? When sixteen-year-old Takamiya Naho receives a mysterious letter, claiming to be from her twenty-seven-year-old self, her life is suddenly thrown into flux. The letter tells her that a new transfer student by the name of Naruse Kakeru will be joining her class, and to keep her eye on him. But why? Naho must decide what to make of the letter and its cryptic warning, and what it means not only for her future, but for Kakeru's as well.

(Source: Anime News Network)

Note: The last episode aired with a runtime of ~40 minutes as opposed to the standard 24 minute long episode.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description: [Website](https://www.choco-de.net/) | [Twitter (JP)](https://twitter.com/manga_ichigo_t) | [Twitter (EN)](https://twitter.com/ichigo_takano) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ichigotakano111)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1521695330)

Currently working as a freelancer, having previously worked for [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) and [D.A.S.T.](https://anilist.co/studio/6255/)

Yuuki graduated from Saitama Prefectural Toda Shoyo High School and has been active in the school's "Manga and Anime Research Interest Club.” He found business in the National Health Insurance but couldn't give up on being an animator, so he left and became an animator instead. Has collaborated with director [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/) many times, including on his most famous work, [The Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/).

He works on doujinshi under the circles The Man in the High Castle and Ubik, both references to the works of American science fiction author Philip K. Dick. The published doujinshi include key animation from his body of work and specially drawn manga. On the other hand, since he worked on Ralphilia Saga by [Akara Arisato](https://anilist.co/staff/149449/), he has been involved in several works as a guest member of the doujin circle La Moon.

__Graduated:__ Sapporo Gakuin University (Faculty of Humanities)

__[Website](https://www.takahashiyu.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takahashiyu) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takahashiyu.official)__

__Yu Takahashi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger, formerly signed to record label Amuse and now under Warner Music Japan.

__[Website](https://kobukuro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TeamKobukuro) | [Instagram (run by Shunsuke)](https://www.instagram.com/kobukuro_kuroda_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/kobukuroofficialTV)__

__Formed:__ 1998

__Introduction:__
Kobukuro is a Japanese musical duo under record label Warner Music Japan (2001–), having previously been under MINOSUKE RECORDS (1999–2000), who have been active between September 1998 and August 2011, with a break between August 2011 and March 2012, resuming band activities from April 2012.

The name of the unit stems from the first four letters from each of the members' family name, where Kobu comes from __Kobu__chi, while Kuro comes from __Kuro__da.

__Members:__
- [Shunsuke Kuroda](https://anilist.co/staff/173356/Shunsuke-Kuroda) (黒田俊介, くろだしゅんすけ) – vocalist, sometimes in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Kentarou Kobuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/173355/Kentarou-Kobuchi) (小渕健太郎, こぶちけんたろう) – guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Graduated:__ Sapporo Gakuin University (Faculty of Humanities)

__[Website](https://www.takahashiyu.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takahashiyu) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takahashiyu.official)__

__Yu Takahashi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger, formerly signed to record label Amuse and now under Warner Music Japan.

__Yu Takahashi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger, formerly signed to record label Amuse and now under Warner Music Japan.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikekubo_kouichi)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Yamaha Music Academy
__Nicknames:__ いけっち (Ikecchi), 池ちゃん (Ike-chan), ツボ氏 (Tsubo-shi)

__Kouichi Ikekubo__, alternatively known by stage name Kouichi, is a Japanese lyricist, guitarist, arranger and member of rock band Bahashishi, who has been active since 2002.

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki City, Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Miyazaki Prefectural Miyazaki Technical High School

__Kentarou Kobuchi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of musical duo [Kobukuro](https://anilist.co/staff/102943/Kobukuro), who has been active since 1998. In the duo Kobukuro he is in-charge of the lyrics and composition.

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki City, Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Miyazaki Prefectural Miyazaki Technical High School

__Kentarou Kobuchi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of musical duo [Kobukuro](https://anilist.co/staff/102943/Kobukuro), who has been active since 1998. In the duo Kobukuro he is in-charge of the lyrics and composition.

The name of the unit stems from the first four letters from each of the members' family name, where Kobu comes from __Kobu__chi, while Kuro comes from __Kuro__da.

title.native: あの日見た花の名前を僕達はまだ知らない。
色づく世界の明日から
荒ぶる季節の乙女どもよ。
青春ブタ野郎はバニーガール先輩の夢を見ない
失われた未来を求めて
さくら荘のペットな彼女
シュタインズ・ゲート
劇場版 ヴァイオレット・エヴァーガーデン
ヴァイオレット・エヴァーガーデン
